thread.title: 4 teens arrested on accusations of robbery, binding victims with duct tape in Salem home
thread.title_full: 4 teens arrested on accusations of robbery, binding victims with duct tape in Salem home | OregonLive.com

author: Nuran Alteir | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: 4 teens arrested on accusations of robbery, binding victims with duct tape in Salem home
text:
Four teenagers have been arrested after police say they bound several people — shooting one — inside a Salem home with the intention to rob last week.
Police say George Zaichenko, Pavel Arkhipenco, both 18, as well as two juvenile boys ages 16 and 17, were armed with several guns when they entered a home in the 1600 block of Berry Street Southeast on Oct. 14.
The four confronted "several victims" in the home and bound them with duct tape, according to a news release from the Salem Police Department. One victim was shot while trying to fight off the intruders. The injuries were not life threatening, according to police. The 16-year-old suspect was also shot. Police later found him in northeast Salem and took him to Salem Hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
Following an investigation, Salem Police detectives served three search warrants and arrested the four suspects Oct. 16 on charges of burglary, assault, unlawful use of a weapon and five counts of robbery.
While the investigation is still ongoing, police believe the robbery to be narcotics related. The identities of the victims are not being released.
— Nuran Alteir
